entry.title: Dovecote
entry.summary:
Author: KilldevilandtheWildThings

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 77,661Chapters: 14/20Kudos: 113

Summary: Buck held the little plastic bird close in front of his eyes, twisting it back and forth.“You can say it, Buck,” Eddie encouraged, quietly. “To put it out there in… the universe. And you’ll see her tomorrow, anyway.”“I think…” Buck took a huge breath, breathing deep into his chest, past the hurt, past the hard rock of anxiety that sat at its center, past the tears welling in his eyes; he aimed all of it back out, straight into the heart of the deep, deep universe.“I think I met my daughter tonight.” or;A work of fate or God or man or the universe crosses the paths of Buck and a small, green-eyed girl with a bird in her palm and the future in her snaggle-toothed grin. Two and a half years after the events of Lighthouse, the Diazes become the Diazes.

entry.title: The Good I’ll Do
entry.summary:
Author: ScribblesAfterDark

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 28,955Chapters: 20/24Kudos: 233

Summary: “I leave in a week,” Eddie said quietly. “Minimum Five-month deployment.”The spoon clattered against the counter, the sharp sound cutting through the air. Buck’s jaw tightened, his eyes narrowing with something too tangled to be just anger. “Five months? You were supposed to be done in three. No more deployments…We were supposed to finally settle down. Put down some roots. Be on the same fucking continent for more than a few months at a time.”Or, They survived deployments and the kind of chaos only Buck could attract. Falling in love should’ve been the easy part. Now married and raising Christopher, they’ve finally built the family they once only dreamed about…except Eddie’s been deployed again, and long-distance is proving tougher than any mission.

entry.title: Run-Around (Run to Ground)
entry.summary:
Author: WhenTheLastStoneFalls

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,034Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 23

Summary: Eddie tilted his head, off put by Buck’s outburst, and Buck crossed his arms and gripped his elbows tightly. Hen tried to make eye contact in the rear view mirror, but he turned his face back to the window, refusing to meet her gaze. He didn’t want to look at Hen, and certainly didn't want to look at Eddie. Eddie had been withdrawing from him, and it hurt. Even thinking about it made his skin crawl more intensely. He wasn’t sure if he’d let slip his feelings in some way, or if he’d done something else, but he could not stand Eddie’s disapproval on top of everything else.—The boys take different paths to process their grief, and somehow still end up at the same place.Featuring: Undiagnosed ADHD, sensory seeking behavior, bad coping skills, Buck 1.2, Eddie figuring some stuff out and being the one with his shit together (for once), and a scheming Maddie.

entry.title: The Sun City
entry.summary:
Author: Desscard

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 52,452Chapters: 10/10Kudos: 35

Summary: "This is a private spot."The blond kid’s defensiveness immediately hardened into a sneer. He visibly straightened up, puffing out his chest in a subtle shift that made him seem even taller, a clear display of masculine posturing. "Oh, yeah? Didn't see your name on it. Is this your rock? Your blade of grass? Did you pee on the trees to mark your territory?"The sarcasm grated on Eddie's last nerve. "Some of us come here for peace and quiet. Not to listen to... whatever that noise was.""It's called music," the kid shot back, his voice dripping with condescension. He took a deliberate step forward, closing the distance between them and invading Eddie's personal space. It was a clear challenge. "You should try it sometime. Might loosen you up." He smirked. "Or is that against the rules in your special, secret clubhouse?"Or:The Buckleys move to El Paso along with a 17-year-old Buck. Buck meets Eddie and it's hate from the first sight. Shenanigans ensue.

entry.title: Tell Him
entry.summary:
Author: beetlesandstars

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,565Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 48

Summary: Rubbing at his nose, Jessie continues, “You’re an incredible boyfriend, Buck. An incredible guy, but it’s— it’s unfair.” “You don’t— Jess, I’ve been all in with you, you’ve gotta give me that.” “I do. I am,” Jessie fingers wrap around Buck’s, squeezing once. “But this– there’s a kid involved. And, look, we haven’t talked about kids, but I know I don’t want any. I— I think you do. Am I right?” Quietly, feeling as though he’s confessing something awful, Buck says, “Yeah.” Jessie nods, eyes darting down to the floor before finding Buck’s again. “And, um. Eddie.” “What about Eddie?”  Buck moves out of Eddie’s house and finds himself a boyfriend. Shockingly, this does not go well.

entry.title: and i want it all
entry.summary:
Author: Storiomaniac1

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 707Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 17

Summary: They had talked, early and often, about the parental role Buck had always and would hopefully always continue to have in Chris’s life, about how much Buck loved him. It had nearly made Eddie’s heart burst, then, how well Buck took care of his kid. He had known, of course, that Chris saw Buck like a dad, too, had melted over the fact time and time again. But suddenly, the thought of fathers’ day made him panic.Because Buck loved, Chris, of course he did, but what if he also just felt obligated to take on the parental role? Buck had always talked about wanting a family, kids of his own one day. And Eddie, well, he had always thought that Chris would be his one and only. orEddie is having a bit of a crisis. Buck, as always, is there to remind him how much he loves their little family.

entry.title: i'm on the hunt (i'm after you)
entry.summary:
Author: PhenomenalWoman

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,185Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 87

Summary: Eddie is fast. Buck doesn’t know when to give up. You can imagine what happens next.***“We should race, is all I’m saying.”Eddie shoots him a look like he wants to ask why on Earth Buck, as a grown ass man, would want to race another grown ass man before he simply shrugs. “If you want. Just to my house?” He points forward, where Eddie’s mailbox is quickly coming into view.“Not now,” Buck shakes his head but his chest tightens at the thought. Weird. “I’m already tired, I don’t want to be at a disadvantage. Not that I think you would have the advantage over me, but we should be at our best.”Eddie laughs again, softer and less surprised. “At our best,” he repeats. “Right.” He leans closer, getting right up into Buck’s personal space until all Buck can smell is sweat and Eddie. “I think you just don’t want to lose,” Eddie taunts, and Buck is close enough to have front row access to the way a droplet of sweat drips from his hair and slides down his temple and cheek until it hooks down his jaw and underneath the collar of his tank top.

entry.title: Buck, Bothered, and Bisexual
entry.summary:
Author: 1dalso

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,095Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 30

Summary: It’s as if time slows down, or the world comes to an abrupt halt.Not only is this guy probably the same age as Buck, but fuck. This might just be the hottest guy he’s ever seen— and he likes girls."Phew! That’s one fine man,” whistles Hen from the kitchen, sidling up besides Chimney, “And I like girls.”Buck eagerly nods in agreement, because who’s he kidding, he likes girls too. But hey, attraction is each to their own, and he finds whatever this is, quite attractive.He can unpack that later. Preferably at home. Maybe with a beer. Or two.—Buck and Eddie meet for the first time on the cusp of Buck's bisexual awakening. How much of the newbie, Eddie Diaz, can Buck handle before he takes matters into his own hands... and maybe gives those matters a kiss on the mouth?

entry.title: What Lies Behind
entry.summary:
Author: ParkAfterDark

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 37,821Chapters: 10/?Kudos: 935

Summary: Later—after he has drifted in and out of consciousness over and over, like rising out of a churning sea, first to the park ranger, who cannot stop crying, then in the back of the ambulance, and finally at the hospital, where the nurses speak to him in gentle voices that make him want to rip his own hair out at the roots and he finally stays awake, the pain too intense to allow him to drift back to the bottom of that warm dark water—Buck’s first clear thought will be, But it was all going so well.***Buck is attacked on his day off. In the aftermath of everything that's happened - from Maddie's leaving to Eddie's breakdown - he decides the best way to deal with it is to hide it.It goes about as well as one would expect.

entry.title: Picking up the Pieces
entry.summary:
Author: analyticalabsorbed

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 73,183Chapters: 17/?Kudos: 577

Summary: The lawsuit is done, Buck is back at work, it'll take time, but everything will return to normal eventually, right? The firehouse crew is hurt, and Buck is struggling. He starts to spiral, going back to his old habits, with no one there to see or catch him. How long can he last on the downward trajectory? Or will someone notice before it's too late?i.e Buck struggles with his mental health and relationships following a lawsuit against his fire department.I'm bad at summaries. Just your typical post-lawsuit fic.

entry.title: Visible: The Evan Buckley story
entry.summary:
Author: Ackorna

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,135Chapters: 19/19Kudos: 4

Summary: Evan “Buck” Buckley has always been brave in the field—but when it comes to sharing his true self, he’s learned that visibility is both powerful and terrifying. From magazine spreads to public panels, from quiet moments at the 118 to heart-to-heart conversations at home with Eddie and Christopher, Buck navigates coming out, bisexuality, and the impact of his story on fans struggling with identity and mental health.Amid playful teasing from the firehouse, heartfelt family support, and the scrutiny of public attention, Buck discovers what it truly means to be seen, loved, and brave—both in front of the world and behind closed doors.
